D2A7138099714B208F0431FF40E59946.description: develop and/or select pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements in manufacturing technology, for inclusion in a portfolio (e.g., work logs, skills checklist, sketches, photographs of projects).

E2B6BF7B3B024BC691FC748F1EF6C823.description: demonstrate an understanding of the work habits that are important for success in the manufacturing industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., working safely, teamwork, reliability);

52E13CA908634DAFBC6454ADED1CDC4E.description: demonstrate an understanding of the Essential Skills that are important for success in the manufacturing industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., measurement and calculation, finding information, problem solving);

191D5D96E3CA4F299027B6D10C074A53.description: identify groups and programs that are available to support students who are interested in pursuing non-traditional career choices in the manufacturing industry (e.g., mentoring programs, virtual networking/support groups, specialized postsecondary programs, relevant trade/industry associations);

DF4A5120F26C46A4A664F39A81AEFC2A.description: identify the education and training requirements for various careers in the manufacturing industry;

DD5BAE3321C7409B9C097F04838BB6A9.description: identify a variety of career opportunities in the manufacturing industry;

7830D5F16E034759AF0C8AAFEE4967E0.description: Career Opportunities: describe career opportunities in the manufacturing industry and the education and training required for these careers.

441481345F554CBCB70F7436DA71CBA7.description: use protective clothing and equipment as required to ensure their own and others' safety in the work environment.

178E13105111417E844807AB681D363B.description: demonstrate the safe use of tools and equipment in compliance with safety manuals, instructions, and institutional requirements;

F42FEBC50479487FBEA8D642F4FBDBC6.description: demonstrate compliance with health and safety standards (e.g., rules, procedures) related to facilities, processes, materials, tools, and equipment (e.g., ensure that correct fire extinguishers and blankets are accessible, appropriate equipment guards are in place, and materials and chemicals are appropriately labelled);

0619CDCED60F49FD92C04D52912B50B4.description: identify health and safety roles, responsibilities, and procedures in manufacturing (e.g., concerning choice of equipment and materials, maintenance of equipment, storing of materials and equipment, inspection of facilities and equipment, in-service and training);

531524D3A28742C0A57887F30F343FCB.description: identify and explain the importance of legislation and standards related to procedures and operations used in manufacturing facilities (e.g., Occupational Health and Safety Act [OHSA], Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System [WHMIS]) and the relevant oversight/ regulatory organizations (e.g., Workplace Safety and Insurance Board [WSIB]);

235D886AABD24DC4B23E982A9BD0A88E.description: Health and Safety: identify and demonstrate compliance with health and safety legislation, standards, and procedures related to the manufacturing industry;

F6C2E5AB53024393A99573BEB3C419DD.description: evaluate from various perspectives (e.g., safety, technical, financial, environmental, ethical) the effects of new and emerging manufacturing technologies (e.g., wireless technology in cell phones and personal digital assistants [PDAs], improved materials and design in sports equipment that offer better protection, collision avoidance safety feature on motor vehicles) on culture and society.

C7ACA93C41614E73A5E3D2558406226A.description: identify the economic benefits that the manufacturing industry can provide at the local and provincial levels;

3315BDEB7A724090ADE4510FAB96402A.description: describe the past and present effects of manufacturing on society (e.g., changes in work environments and lifestyle brought about by the Industrial Revolution, rising standards of living, widespread availability of consumer goods, effect of resource extraction on Aboriginal communities, effect on developing countries that accept industrialized countries' waste), and predict how manufacturing will affect society in the future;

D5BF58F2486E468889010E7ECEBE0A63.description: Technology and Society: demonstrate an understanding of ways in which the manufacturing industry affects society.

9D86F015E6514C1AA0FA751DAF072E21.description: explain the need for environmental stewardship and describe how the manufacturing industry can act in an environmentally responsible way (e.g., by harvesting raw materials in a sustainable manner, using energy from renewable sources, making products that can be recycled, ensuring ethical treatment of people affected by manufacturing activities).

C4EC399959594976983B5B205C38C419.description: use proper storage and disposal techniques of materials and waste products, ensuring that there is a minimal effect on the environment;

4E8059E091C54C6BBA95F2067A30AB79.description: explain the importance of "reduce, reuse, and recycle" and life cycle assessment (LCA) when designing, manufacturing, and marketing a product;

F5598476C1034A87AD1FB52C3D37E112.description: identify ways in which manufacturing affects the environment today (e.g., through the demand for raw materials, creation of greenhouse gases, disposal of waste materials), and predict how the effects will change in the future;

319D9E807D5247D492E59BAE2D5AF669.description: Technology and the Environment: demonstrate an understanding of ways in which the manufacturing industry affects the environment;

EFBAC58AC83D4A74A385CEE2960F97D6.description: use an appropriate inspection technique (e.g., statistical process control [SPC], inspection report, rubric) to evaluate projects and ensure quality

892D45DF2F044186BE9179CEB3EE0B81.description: select and use a variety of measuring tools (e.g., calipers, scales, micrometers) to measure projects accurately, according to specifications;

84EF0A0226054CF7BD16A3403E756A11.description: Metrology Skills: demonstrate the use of metrology skills to measure, lay out, and inspect a product.

13A9EF4BEEA94146A6D7D5BAC1BC796D.description: demonstrate safe workplace practices and behaviours (e.g., follow instructions, keep work area clean and dry, don't distract other workers) when using materials, tools, and equipment to manufacture a product.

51F73D5E5F094EBCBE352ED8EB298D59.description: use the proper procedures for maintaining and storing materials, tools, and equipment;

79DAD880F2CA4483A6CBB24B4FB62B92.description: use various hand tools, power tools, machine tools, and related equipment (e.g., saws, grinders, milling machine, engine lathe, welding equipment, vacuum-forming machine) safely and correctly to manufacture a product;

365AAA11FB5847D5AF0B4B2DEE84A217.description: set up hand tools, machine tools, power tools, and equipment (e.g., jigs and fixtures, clamps, engine lathe, welding equipment, milling machine, drill press, injection-moulding machine) properly in preparation for the manufacture of a product (e.g., robotic challenge, design challenge, fabrication project);

CE1857825C834D0A8EFD6B7E84DBB9C2.description: Using Materials,Tools, and Equipment: use hand tools, machine tools, power tools, materials, and equipment safely and correctly in the manufacture of a product

8EB8F3331CAA4AFB9112002105723266.description: use appropriate methods of assembly (e.g., joining, bonding, crimping, fastening) based on design criteria and specifications.

3D7962F2130047AB8D4D69AC899A492F.description: use correct procedures to prepare materials for the manufacture of a product (e.g., layout, cutting to rough length, squaring, drilling, weld preparation, deburring);

52748DCA13E44222BD2D362AEB0C9022.description: develop a process plan for the manufacture of a product (e.g., create a work plan, identify appropriate tools and equipment, produce a bill of material, develop a budget for the project);

746A95AC11554D56879DE5C45F1392F3.description: identify and select appropriate materials required to manufacture a product;

EEFDBBBD9DC34742A711691A4CE0F938.description: Process Planning: develop and use a manufacturing process plan to produce a product;

1931EAE94E6946748A41E4886CE02AB3.description: accurately interpret technical drawings and other resources (e.g., reports, literature, manuals) as they design and manufacture products.

A3F9672DF1764F40A68D8496141BB54D.description: develop technical drawings (e.g., orthographic, isometric, and assembly drawings) and technical reports, as required in the design and manufacture of a product;

98828B345BBA412C97CAD0D0F4548964.description: prepare and present appropriately organized design briefs for a variety of manufacturing challenges (e.g., briefs that contain an analysis of the challenge, design criteria, multiple solutions to the challenge, evaluation of the product);

04BD9647AA6849C7BF64650E646AEF20.description: apply appropriate technological concepts (see pp. 5-6) as an integral part of the design process;

E4DEC88317E649D4974BD74A1D478B8F.description: follow a design process that includes identification of the particular need or problem, consideration of design criteria and constraints, development of multiple solutions, selection of the optimal solution, evaluation of the product, and life cycle assessment (LCA);

53F09DF5BCA941DA8AE35DDBEC2ACB10.description: Design Process: apply an appropriate design process to plan and develop a product;

D723BDC5D0584CE9A20AE4575441AD20.description: describe procedures for preventive maintenance and proper storage of hand tools, power tools, machine tools, and equipment used in manufacturing.

28EA204FFCFC44008E2067B8CCC79057.description: describe the properties and characteristics of various natural and manufactured materials (e.g., woods, metals, plastics, ceramics, fabrics) and their suitability for use in manufacturing;

3CEC784AE7754C2AB036A18EE681FA9E.description: identify and describe the hand tools, machine tools, power tools, and equipment (e.g., saw, drill, engine lathe, vacuum forming machine, computer hardware and software) used in the design and fabrication of a variety of projects (e.g., robotic challenge, design challenge, fabrication project);

8723EC77C9DA45EA94CFA139140823B2.description: Materials,Tools, and Equipment: identify and explain how various materials, tools, and equipment are used in the manufacture of products.

4D7B9CEE245F48BEA2DEB16CCC4110E5.description: describe how various forms of communication (e.g., group discussion, brainstorming), graphic representation (e.g., sketches, technical drawings, computer-aided design [CAD]), and documentation (e.g., research reports, design briefs) are used in the development of project ideas.

4E19D9B4425D4BB2B0E4D8FF45DFD786.description: identify technological concepts (e.g., aesthetics, control, environmental sustainability/stewardship, ergonomics, fabrication, function, innovation, material, mechanism, power and energy, structure, safety, systems) (see pp. 5-6) and particular environmental concerns (e.g., pollution, disposal of waste, packaging, recycling) that are important considerations in product design;

A27089D0C7EA4696A663AA667311D52B.description: identify and describe the steps of a design process used to plan and develop solutions to challenges in manufacturing technology (e.g., describe and analyse a situation and define the specific problem or need; research criteria, constraints, and availability of materials; generate a number of possible solutions, using techniques such as brainstorming; select the optimal solution; test and evaluate the product; repeat steps as necessary);

EA9DCAC93B91479894CC64A5AF4719F7.description: Design Fundamentals: demonstrate an understanding of how a design process is used in the planning and development of a manufacturing project;

7EB5C89A35014619B4A25D32DDB0C856.description: describe ways in which manufacturing technology affects people's daily lives (e.g., by providing improved consumer products, developing new diagnostic equipment in health care, creating more energy-efficient means of transport).

66168EA194A34E348E2C96B29EFD4795.description: identify and describe production methods (e.g., custom, assembly line, flexible, mass production) used in the manufacture of various products;

60A7F874AECA4B4AB364439227606B3D.description: identify key areas of operation in manufacturing (e.g., design of product, production planning, fabrication of product, quality control);

6A34FF6F2DB146C99B2F5E2BABE18530.description: describe major differences between primary manufacturing industries (e.g., iron and steel, lumber, paper, petroleum) and secondary manufacturing industries (e.g., automotive, aerospace, chemicals, plastics, textiles);

86E53F9771794B52B48809B9DE0FC45E.description: The Manufacturing Industry: demonstrate an understanding of the manufacturing industry and of processes and technologies related to manufacturing;
